head.title: EGL AGREES TO BUY CIRCLE INTERNATIONAL

hedline.hl1: EGL AGREES TO BUY CIRCLE INTERNATIONAL

abstract.p: EGL Inc agrees to purchase Circle International Group in $543 million stock swap (S)

block.p: EGL Inc. said yesterday that it would buy Circle International Group in a $543 million stock swap that will create a global freight transportation company with combined revenues of $1.4 billion. Each of Circle's common shares will be converted into one share of EGL common stock, valuing San Francisco-based Circle at $543 million, based on EGL's closing share price on Friday. Shares of EGL, which is based in Houston, fell $2.5156, to $28.2343 on the Nasdaq stock market while Circle shares rose $2.3125, to $27.4375. The combined company will have more than 8,300 employees.
